guidance: Compliance exception review. Look for: exception request process; approval authority; compensating controls; time limits; regular review.
what_good_looks_like: Exception process and approval authority and compensating controls and time limits and regular review and current count known and tracked
red_flags: No exception process; Authority unclear; No compensating controls; No time limits; Not reviewed; Count unknown
nc_pattern: Compliance exceptions not managed with appropriate controls and time limits.

control_name: Compliance with Policies Rules and Standards
question: How is compliance status reported to management?
guidance: Compliance reporting review. Look for: compliance dashboards; management reports; trend analysis; risk-based prioritisation.
what_good_looks_like: Compliance dashboards and management reports and trend analysis and risk-based prioritisation and regular reporting and management visibility
red_flags: No dashboards; No reports; No trend analysis; Not prioritised; Irregular reporting; Management unaware
nc_pattern: Compliance status not reported to management effectively.

control_name: Compliance with Policies Rules and Standards
question: How are compliance violations addressed?
guidance: Violation response review. Look for: remediation process; disciplinary linkage; root cause analysis; recurrence prevention.
auditor_focus: Show me how a violation was addressed.
what_good_looks_like: Remediation process and disciplinary linkage and root cause analysis and recurrence prevention and examples available and consistent
red_flags: No remediation process; No disciplinary linkage; No RCA; Recurrence not prevented; No examples
nc_pattern: Compliance violations not addressed with root cause analysis and recurrence prevention.

question: Are operating procedures documented for critical processes?
guidance: Procedure documentation review. Look for: procedure documentation; coverage of security operations; version control; review dates.
what_good_looks_like: Procedures for critical processes and security operations covered and version control and review dates and comprehensive and current
red_flags: Critical processes undocumented; Security operations missing; No version control; Review dates missing
nc_pattern: Operating procedures not documented for critical security processes.

question: How are procedures made accessible to relevant personnel?
guidance: Procedure accessibility review. Look for: documentation repository; access controls; search capability; offline access for emergency.
auditor_focus: Can staff find procedures when needed?
what_good_looks_like: Documentation repository and appropriate access controls and search capability and offline access and staff can find and accessible
red_flags: No repository; Access too restricted; No search; No offline access; Staff cannot find
nc_pattern: Operating procedures not accessible to relevant personnel when needed.

question: How often are procedures reviewed and updated?
guidance: Procedure review cycle assessment. Look for: review schedule; update triggers; change management; owner accountability.
what_good_looks_like: Review schedule and update triggers and change management and owner accountability and recent review and changes tracked
red_flags: No review schedule; Triggers undefined; No change management; No accountability; Not reviewed
nc_pattern: Operating procedures not reviewed and updated at required intervals.

question: Do procedures include security steps?
guidance: Security integration review. Look for: security embedded in procedures not separate; verification checkpoints; security considerations.
auditor_focus: Is security integral or bolted on?
what_good_looks_like: Security embedded in procedures and verification checkpoints and security considerations and not separate and comprehensive coverage
red_flags: Security separate; No checkpoints; Considerations missing; Bolted on; Coverage incomplete
nc_pattern: Security steps not integrated into operating procedures.

question: How is staff competence on procedures verified?
guidance: Procedure competence review. Look for: training records; competency verification; procedure acknowledgment; periodic assessment.
what_good_looks_like: Training records and competency verification and acknowledgment and periodic assessment and staff competent and documented
red_flags: No training records; Competency not verified; No acknowledgment; No assessment; Staff incompetent
nc_pattern: Staff competence on operating procedures not verified.

question: Provide your pre-employment screening policy.
guidance: Screening requirements verification. Look for: check types including criminal and employment history and qualifications; timing requirements; role-based requirements; proportionality to risk level.
auditor_focus: Are all candidates screened before starting?
what_good_looks_like: Comprehensive screening policy covering all check types and timing requirements and role-based proportionality and consistent application and documented procedures
red_flags: No screening policy; Inconsistent application; Checks not completed before start; No role differentiation; Ad-hoc approach
nc_pattern: Pre-employment screening policy not documented or not consistently applied.

question: How is screening proportional to role sensitivity?
guidance: Tiered screening review. Look for: risk-based approach proportional to information classification level; enhanced checks for privileged roles and admin access; access level differentiation; documented criteria for tiering.
auditor_focus: What extra checks for sensitive roles?
what_good_looks_like: Tiered screening based on access levels and enhanced checks for privileged roles and documented criteria for each tier and risk-based approach demonstrated and consistent application
red_flags: No tiering; Same checks for all roles; Privileged roles not identified; No risk-based approach; Criteria undocumented
nc_pattern: Screening not proportional to role sensitivity or privileged access requirements.

question: Are ongoing or periodic checks conducted?
guidance: Periodic re-screening review. Look for: re-screening policy; trigger events defined; frequency for sensitive roles; continuous monitoring where applicable.
auditor_focus: Is screening a one-time event or ongoing?
what_good_looks_like: Periodic re-screening policy documented and trigger events defined and frequency appropriate to role sensitivity and records maintained and continuous monitoring where justified
red_flags: One-time screening only; No re-screening policy; Trigger events not defined; No records of periodic checks
nc_pattern: Ongoing screening not conducted for roles with continued access to sensitive information.

question: How are contractors and third parties screened?
guidance: Third party screening review. Look for: contract requirements for screening; equivalent standards applied; evidence collection; verification process.
what_good_looks_like: Contract requirements specify screening and equivalent standards to employees and evidence collected from suppliers and verification conducted and records maintained
red_flags: No contractor screening requirements; Lower standards than employees; No evidence collection; Verification not conducted
nc_pattern: Contractors and third parties not subject to equivalent screening requirements.

question: Is screening compliant with applicable laws?
guidance: Legal compliance review. Look for: privacy considerations addressed; consent requirements met; record retention appropriate; discrimination avoidance documented.
what_good_looks_like: Privacy considerations documented and consent obtained before checks and retention periods compliant and discrimination avoided and legal review conducted and procedures updated for changes
red_flags: Privacy requirements ignored; No consent obtained; Excessive retention; Discriminatory practices; No legal review
nc_pattern: Screening practices not demonstrably compliant with applicable privacy and employment laws.

question: Do employment contracts include security responsibilities?
guidance: Contract review for security content. Look for: security clauses in contracts; confidentiality obligations; acceptable use acknowledgment; post-employment obligations; consequences for breach.
auditor_focus: Show me the security clauses in contracts.
what_good_looks_like: Security clauses in all contracts and confidentiality obligations defined and acceptable use acknowledgment required and post-employment obligations included and consequences documented
red_flags: No security clauses; Confidentiality missing; No acknowledgment required; Post-employment not addressed; Consequences unclear
nc_pattern: Employment contracts do not include information security responsibilities.

question: How are security obligations communicated to new starters?
guidance: Onboarding security communication review. Look for: induction materials covering security; policy acknowledgment process; security briefing provided; ongoing communication plan.
auditor_focus: Is security emphasised from day one?
what_good_looks_like: Security in induction materials and policy acknowledgment recorded and security briefing provided and ongoing communication plan and new starter checklist includes security
red_flags: Security not in induction; No acknowledgment process; No briefing; Ongoing communication absent; Checklist incomplete
nc_pattern: Security obligations not communicated to new starters during onboarding.

question: Do contracts address post-employment obligations?
guidance: Post-employment terms review. Look for: confidentiality continuing after termination; return of assets requirements; ongoing restrictions; enforceability provisions.
what_good_looks_like: Confidentiality continues after termination and asset return requirements and ongoing restrictions documented and enforceable provisions included and duration specified
red_flags: Post-employment not addressed; No asset return clause; Restrictions unclear; Not enforceable; No duration
nc_pattern: Post-employment security obligations not addressed in employment contracts.

question: Are equivalent terms applied to contractors?
guidance: Contractor terms review. Look for: contract clauses for non-employees; equivalent security obligations; compliance monitoring requirements; consequences for breach.
auditor_focus: Do contractor contracts mirror employee terms?
what_good_looks_like: Equivalent clauses in contractor contracts and security obligations equivalent to employees and compliance monitoring included and consequences documented and regular review
red_flags: Lower standards for contractors; Security obligations missing; No monitoring; No consequences; Contracts not reviewed
nc_pattern: Contractor contracts do not include equivalent security terms to employee contracts.

question: How are changes to terms communicated?
guidance: Terms update process review. Look for: update notification process; re-acknowledgment requirements; version tracking; evidence of communication.
auditor_focus: How do employees know terms have changed?
what_good_looks_like: Update notification process documented and re-acknowledgment required for material changes and version tracking maintained and communication records kept and timely notification
red_flags: No notification process; No re-acknowledgment; No version tracking; No communication records; Delayed notification
nc_pattern: Changes to security terms not communicated to employees with acknowledgment.

control_name: Information Security Awareness Education and Training
question: Provide your security awareness program.
guidance: Program comprehensiveness review. Look for: program documentation; content coverage including policies and threats and procedures; delivery methods; frequency; target audience definition.
what_good_looks_like: Comprehensive program documentation and content covering all key areas and multiple delivery methods and appropriate frequency and target audiences defined and current content
red_flags: No program documentation; Limited content coverage; Single delivery method; Infrequent training; Audiences undefined
nc_pattern: Security awareness program not documented or lacks comprehensive content coverage.

control_name: Information Security Awareness Education and Training
question: What is your training completion rate?
guidance: Completion metrics review. Look for: completion rate target minimum 95%; tracking mechanism; follow-up for non-completion; escalation process for persistent non-compliance.
what_good_looks_like: Completion rate at or above 95% target and tracking mechanism in place and follow-up for non-completion and escalation process documented and trends tracked
red_flags: Completion rate below 95%; No tracking mechanism; No follow-up; No escalation; Declining trend
nc_pattern: Training completion rate below target with inadequate follow-up for non-completion.

control_name: Information Security Awareness Education and Training
question: Is role-specific training provided?
guidance: Specialised training review. Look for: developer security training; privileged user training; incident responder training; content details per role; completion tracking by role.
auditor_focus: What extra training for high-risk roles?
what_good_looks_like: Developer security training including OWASP and privileged user training and incident responder training and role-specific content documented and completion tracked by role
red_flags: No role-specific training; Generic content for all; Developer training missing; Privileged users untrained; No tracking by role
nc_pattern: Role-specific security training not provided for high-risk roles.

control_name: Information Security Awareness Education and Training
question: How is training effectiveness measured?
guidance: Effectiveness measurement review. Look for: assessment or testing; knowledge retention checks; phishing simulation results; behaviour change metrics.
auditor_focus: How do you know training is effective?
what_good_looks_like: Assessment testing conducted and knowledge retention measured and phishing simulations run and behaviour metrics tracked and improvement demonstrated over time
red_flags: No assessment; No retention checks; No simulations; No behaviour metrics; No improvement evidence
nc_pattern: Training effectiveness not measured through assessment or behaviour change tracking.

control_name: Information Security Awareness Education and Training
question: How is content updated for new threats?
guidance: Content currency review. Look for: content review schedule; current threat incorporation; regulatory updates included; industry trends addressed; update process documented.
what_good_looks_like: Content review schedule documented and current threats incorporated within reasonable timeframe and regulatory updates included and industry trends addressed and last update within 12 months
red_flags: No review schedule; Content outdated over 12 months; Threats not incorporated; Regulatory gaps; No update process
nc_pattern: Training content not updated for current threats or regulatory changes.

control_name: Information Security Awareness Education and Training
question: Provide phishing simulation results.
guidance: Simulation program review. Look for: simulation frequency minimum quarterly; click rates target under 5%; remedial training for failures; trend improvement over time.
auditor_focus: What is your current phishing click rate?
what_good_looks_like: Quarterly or more frequent simulations and click rate under 5% or improving trend and remedial training for failures and trend analysis documented and management reporting
red_flags: No simulations; Infrequent simulations; Click rate above 10%; No remedial training; No trend tracking
nc_pattern: Phishing simulation program absent or click rates above acceptable thresholds.

question: Provide your disciplinary process for security violations.
guidance: Disciplinary procedure review. Look for: procedure documentation; escalation levels defined; HR involvement; legal compliance; fairness provisions.
auditor_focus: Is the process documented and fair?
what_good_looks_like: Disciplinary procedure documented and escalation levels defined and HR involvement specified and legally compliant and fairness provisions included and consistent application
red_flags: No documented procedure; Escalation unclear; No HR involvement; Legal compliance uncertain; Inconsistent application
nc_pattern: Disciplinary process for security violations not documented or inconsistently applied.

question: Is the process communicated to all personnel?
guidance: Process communication review. Look for: policy communication evidence; acknowledgment records; regular reminders; new starter awareness; accessibility.
auditor_focus: Do staff know the consequences of violations?
what_good_looks_like: Process communicated to all personnel and acknowledgment records maintained and regular reminders provided and new starter awareness and easily accessible
red_flags: Not communicated; No acknowledgment; No reminders; New starters unaware; Not accessible
nc_pattern: Disciplinary process not communicated to personnel with acknowledgment.

question: Can you provide examples of process application?
guidance: Process application review. Look for: case examples anonymised; consistency of application; documentation completeness; appropriate outcomes.
what_good_looks_like: Case examples available showing application and consistent application demonstrated and complete documentation and appropriate outcomes and lessons learned
red_flags: No examples; Process not applied; Inconsistent application; Incomplete documentation; Inappropriate outcomes
nc_pattern: Disciplinary process documented but evidence of application not available.

question: Does the process apply to contractors?
guidance: Contractor disciplinary review. Look for: contract clauses for violations; escalation to vendor management; equivalent consequences; enforcement capability.
auditor_focus: Are contractors subject to similar process?
what_good_looks_like: Contract clauses address violations and vendor management escalation defined and equivalent consequences and enforcement capability documented and examples available
red_flags: No contract clauses; No vendor escalation; Lower consequences; No enforcement; No examples
nc_pattern: Disciplinary process does not extend to contractor security violations.

question: How are violations classified by severity?
guidance: Severity classification review. Look for: severity criteria documented; proportionate responses defined; escalation triggers; repeat offense handling.
what_good_looks_like: Severity criteria documented and proportionate responses for each level and escalation triggers defined and repeat offense handling and consistent application
red_flags: No severity criteria; Disproportionate responses; No escalation triggers; Repeat offenses ignored; Inconsistent
nc_pattern: Security violation severity classification not documented or consequences not proportionate.

control_name: Responsibilities After Termination or Change of Employment
question: What post-employment confidentiality obligations exist?
guidance: Post-employment obligations review. Look for: NDA clauses; employment contract terms; duration of obligations specified; enforceability provisions.
what_good_looks_like: NDA clauses in contracts and post-employment terms clear and duration specified and enforceable provisions and legal review conducted
red_flags: No NDA clauses; Terms unclear; Duration not specified; Not enforceable; No legal review
nc_pattern: Post-employment confidentiality obligations not documented or enforceable.

control_name: Responsibilities After Termination or Change of Employment
question: How are departing employees reminded of obligations?
guidance: Exit process review. Look for: exit interview content; written reminders provided; acknowledgment of ongoing obligations; return of materials confirmed.
auditor_focus: Is there a structured exit process?
what_good_looks_like: Structured exit process and security content in exit interview and written reminders provided and acknowledgment obtained and return of materials confirmed and checklist used
red_flags: No exit process; No security content; No reminders; No acknowledgment; Return not confirmed
nc_pattern: Departing employees not reminded of ongoing security obligations during exit process.

control_name: Responsibilities After Termination or Change of Employment
question: How are role changes managed from a security perspective?
guidance: Role change security review. Look for: access review at role change including screening review for elevated access per 6.1; removal of previous access; new role onboarding; timing requirements; documentation.
auditor_focus: Is access reviewed at every role change?
what_good_looks_like: Access reviewed at every role change and previous access removed and new role onboarding includes security and timely execution and documented with approval
red_flags: No role change process; Access not reviewed; Previous access retained; No security onboarding; Delayed execution
nc_pattern: Access rights not reviewed and adjusted when personnel change roles.

control_name: Responsibilities After Termination or Change of Employment
question: How is knowledge transfer managed securely?
guidance: Knowledge transfer security review. Look for: handover procedures; documentation of responsibilities; access transition controls; supervision during handover.
auditor_focus: Is sensitive knowledge protected during transition?
what_good_looks_like: Handover procedures documented and responsibilities documented and access transition controlled and supervision for sensitive handovers and knowledge transfer recorded
red_flags: No handover procedures; Responsibilities undocumented; Uncontrolled access transition; No supervision; No records
nc_pattern: Knowledge transfer during role changes not managed securely.

control_name: Responsibilities After Termination or Change of Employment
question: How are confidentiality obligations enforced?
guidance: Enforcement capability review. Look for: monitoring capability; legal recourse documented; examples of enforcement anonymised; deterrent effect.
what_good_looks_like: Monitoring capability exists and legal recourse documented and examples available and deterrent effect communicated and enforcement demonstrated
red_flags: No monitoring; No legal recourse; No examples; No deterrent; Enforcement not demonstrated
nc_pattern: Post-employment confidentiality obligations not enforceable or enforcement not demonstrated.

question: Are NDAs required for employees and relevant third parties?
guidance: NDA requirement review. Look for: NDA policy; standard templates; signing timing before access; coverage requirements defined.
auditor_focus: Is NDA signing mandatory before access?
what_good_looks_like: NDA policy documented and standard templates available and signing required before access and coverage requirements defined and compliance tracked
red_flags: No NDA policy; No templates; Signing after access; Coverage unclear; No tracking
nc_pattern: NDAs not required before access to confidential information is granted.

question: Do NDAs reflect organisation protection needs?
guidance: NDA content review. Look for: scope of confidential information defined; obligations clear; duration appropriate; remedies specified; mutual vs one-way appropriate.
what_good_looks_like: Scope comprehensively defined and obligations clear and duration appropriate and remedies specified and mutual where appropriate and regularly reviewed
red_flags: Scope too narrow; Obligations unclear; Duration inappropriate; No remedies; Always one-way
nc_pattern: NDAs do not comprehensively reflect organisation information protection needs.

question: Are NDAs reviewed and updated regularly?
guidance: NDA review process verification. Look for: review schedule defined; legal review involvement; update triggers documented; version control maintained.
what_good_looks_like: Review schedule documented and legal review involved and update triggers defined and version control maintained and last review within 24 months
red_flags: No review schedule; No legal involvement; No update triggers; No version control; Review overdue
nc_pattern: NDAs not reviewed and updated at planned intervals.

question: Is there a register of signed NDAs?
guidance: NDA register review. Look for: register maintained; signed copies stored securely; accessibility for reference; expiry tracking; completeness.
auditor_focus: Can you locate any person NDA?
what_good_looks_like: NDA register maintained and signed copies stored securely and accessible for reference and expiry tracking and complete coverage and regular reconciliation
red_flags: No register; Copies not stored; Not accessible; No expiry tracking; Incomplete coverage
nc_pattern: NDA register not maintained or signed copies not accessible.

question: Are mutual NDAs used appropriately?
guidance: Mutual NDA review. Look for: two-way confidentiality for partnerships; equivalent obligations; balanced terms; appropriate use cases.
what_good_looks_like: Mutual NDAs used for partnerships and equivalent obligations defined and balanced terms and appropriate use case determination and documented decisions
red_flags: Always one-way; Obligations unbalanced; Inappropriate use; No documented decisions
nc_pattern: Mutual NDAs not used where two-way confidentiality protection is required.

question: Provide your remote working security policy.
guidance: Remote work policy review. Look for: policy document covering security requirements; approved locations; prohibited activities; technical controls required.
auditor_focus: Are remote work security requirements clear?
what_good_looks_like: Comprehensive remote work policy and security requirements documented and approved locations defined and prohibited activities specified and technical controls mandated
red_flags: No remote policy; Requirements unclear; No approved locations; Prohibited activities undefined; Controls not mandated
nc_pattern: Remote working security policy not documented or lacks clear requirements.

question: What security controls apply to remote working?
guidance: Technical controls review. Look for: VPN requirements; endpoint security; screen lock enforcement; secure Wi-Fi usage; MFA requirement.
what_good_looks_like: VPN mandatory and endpoint security enforced and screen lock with appropriate timeout and secure Wi-Fi guidance and MFA required and controls verified
red_flags: No VPN required; Endpoint security optional; No screen lock; Insecure Wi-Fi permitted; No MFA
nc_pattern: Security controls for remote working not technically enforced.

question: How is data protected when working remotely?
guidance: Remote data protection review. Look for: encryption requirements; secure file access methods; local storage restrictions; printing controls.
auditor_focus: Can sensitive data be saved locally?
what_good_looks_like: Encryption required for remote data and secure file access only and local storage restricted or encrypted and printing controls in place and compliance monitored
red_flags: No encryption requirement; Insecure access permitted; Unrestricted local storage; No printing controls
nc_pattern: Data protection requirements not defined or enforced for remote working.

question: Are remote workers trained on security requirements?
guidance: Remote worker training review. Look for: training content specific to remote work; policy acknowledgment; periodic reminders; compliance verification.
auditor_focus: Have remote workers completed specific training?
what_good_looks_like: Remote-specific training provided and policy acknowledgment recorded and periodic reminders sent and compliance verified and completion tracked
red_flags: No remote training; No acknowledgment; No reminders; Compliance not verified; Tracking absent
nc_pattern: Remote workers not trained on specific security requirements for remote work.

question: How is home working environment security assessed?
guidance: Home environment assessment review. Look for: self-assessment checklist; physical security considerations; network security guidance; verification process.
auditor_focus: What assurance do you have about home setups?
what_good_looks_like: Self-assessment checklist provided and physical security addressed and network security guidance and verification or attestation and regular reassessment
red_flags: No assessment; Physical security ignored; No network guidance; No verification; One-time only
nc_pattern: Home working environment security not assessed or verified.

question: What is the process for reporting security events?
guidance: Reporting process review. Look for: reporting channels including email and portal and phone; 24x7 availability; ease of reporting; acknowledgment to reporter.
what_good_looks_like: Multiple reporting channels available and 24x7 availability and easy to use and acknowledgment provided to reporter and process documented and accessible
red_flags: Single channel only; Not 24x7; Difficult to use; No acknowledgment; Process unclear
nc_pattern: Security event reporting process not accessible or easy to use for all personnel.

question: How are personnel made aware of reporting procedures?
guidance: Reporting awareness review. Look for: training content covering reporting; visible reporting information; regular reminders; new starter induction content.
auditor_focus: Can all staff explain how to report?
what_good_looks_like: Training includes reporting procedures and visible information posted and regular reminders and induction covers reporting and staff awareness verified
red_flags: Not in training; Information not visible; No reminders; Not in induction; Staff unaware
nc_pattern: Personnel not aware of security event reporting procedures.

question: Is there protection for reporters?
guidance: Reporter protection review. Look for: whistleblower protection documented; anonymous reporting option; no retaliation policy; protection communicated.
what_good_looks_like: Whistleblower protection policy and anonymous reporting option available and no retaliation policy documented and protection communicated and enforcement demonstrated
red_flags: No protection policy; No anonymous option; Retaliation policy absent; Not communicated
nc_pattern: Reporter protection from retaliation not documented or not communicated.

question: What types of events should be reported?
guidance: Reporting guidance review. Look for: reportable event examples; clear guidance on thresholds; when in doubt report message; escalation paths.
auditor_focus: Do staff know what to report?
what_good_looks_like: Clear examples of reportable events and guidance on thresholds and when in doubt report message and escalation paths documented and staff awareness verified
red_flags: No examples; Unclear thresholds; No guidance; Escalation undefined; Staff confused
nc_pattern: Guidance on reportable security events not clear or comprehensive.

question: What is the expected reporting timeframe?
guidance: Reporting timeliness review. Look for: timely reporting requirements; escalation for urgent events; acknowledgment timeframe; SLA for response.
what_good_looks_like: Timely reporting requirements documented and urgent event escalation defined and acknowledgment timeframe specified and response SLA and compliance monitored
red_flags: No timing requirements; Urgent events not differentiated; No acknowledgment; No SLA; Compliance not monitored
nc_pattern: Security event reporting timeliness requirements not defined or not monitored.

question: Are physical security perimeters defined?
guidance: Perimeter definition review. Look for: secure areas identified; boundary documentation; security zones mapped; access requirements per zone defined.
what_good_looks_like: Secure areas identified and documented and boundary documentation complete and security zones mapped and access requirements defined per zone and regularly reviewed
red_flags: No perimeter definition; Boundaries undocumented; Zones not mapped; Access requirements unclear; Not reviewed
nc_pattern: Physical security perimeters not defined or documented for secure areas.

question: How are perimeter boundaries documented?
guidance: Boundary documentation review. Look for: floor plans; zone classifications; access point identification; boundary change management.
what_good_looks_like: Floor plans available and zones classified and access points identified and change management for boundaries and regularly updated
red_flags: No floor plans; Zones not classified; Access points unknown; No change management; Outdated
nc_pattern: Physical perimeter boundaries not adequately documented or maintained.

question: Are perimeters regularly assessed for vulnerabilities?
guidance: Perimeter assessment review. Look for: periodic security assessments; penetration points identified; remediation tracked; external threat consideration.
what_good_looks_like: Periodic assessments conducted and penetration points identified and remediation tracked and external threats considered and documented findings
red_flags: No assessments; Penetration points unknown; Remediation not tracked; External threats ignored
nc_pattern: Physical perimeter security not regularly assessed for vulnerabilities.

question: How are emergency exits secured while maintaining safety?
guidance: Emergency exit security review. Look for: alarmed exits; delayed egress where permitted; monitoring of exit use; balance of security and safety.
auditor_focus: Are emergency exits both secure and compliant?
what_good_looks_like: Alarmed exits and delayed egress where permitted and monitoring in place and safety compliance verified and documented procedures
red_flags: Exits not alarmed; No monitoring; Safety compliance unclear; Security compromises safety
nc_pattern: Emergency exits not secured appropriately or safety requirements not met.

question: How is access to secure areas controlled?
guidance: Access control review. Look for: access badges or tokens; biometrics where appropriate; access logs maintained; authorisation process documented; visitor management.
what_good_looks_like: Access badges or biometrics deployed and access logs maintained and authorisation process documented and visitor management in place and regular access review
red_flags: No access control; Logs not maintained; No authorisation process; Visitors unmanaged; No access review
nc_pattern: Physical entry controls not implemented or access logs not maintained.

question: How are visitors managed?
guidance: Visitor management review. Look for: visitor registration process; escort requirements; visitor badges issued; time limits enforced; sign-in and sign-out records.
what_good_looks_like: Visitor registration process documented and escort requirements enforced and visitor badges issued and time limits applied and sign-in and sign-out records maintained
red_flags: No visitor registration; No escort; No badges; No time limits; Records incomplete
nc_pattern: Visitor management procedures not implemented or not consistently applied.

question: Are offices rooms and facilities secured appropriately?
guidance: Facility security review. Look for: access control for sensitive areas; clear desk enforcement; equipment protection; environmental controls; clean room requirements where applicable.
what_good_looks_like: Access control for sensitive areas and clear desk enforced and equipment protected and environmental controls in place and requirements documented per facility type
red_flags: No access control; Clear desk not enforced; Equipment unprotected; No environmental controls; Requirements undocumented
nc_pattern: Offices rooms and facilities not secured according to sensitivity requirements.

question: How are meeting rooms and shared spaces secured?
guidance: Shared space security review. Look for: booking systems; automatic screen lock displays; clean desk after meetings; visitor supervision in meeting rooms.
auditor_focus: Is sensitive information protected in shared spaces?
what_good_looks_like: Booking systems and automatic screen locks and clean desk enforced and visitor supervision and whiteboards cleared and documented procedures
red_flags: No booking control; Displays left on; Clean desk not enforced; Visitors unsupervised
nc_pattern: Meeting rooms and shared spaces not secured for sensitive information protection.

question: Are server rooms and data centres appropriately secured?
guidance: Data centre security review. Look for: dedicated access controls; environmental monitoring; visitor logging; equipment protection; clean room standards where applicable.
auditor_focus: What additional controls protect data centres?
what_good_looks_like: Dedicated access controls and environmental monitoring and visitor logging and equipment protection and documented standards and regular review
red_flags: Same access as offices; No environmental monitoring; Visitors not logged; Equipment unprotected
nc_pattern: Server rooms and data centres not secured to appropriate standards.

question: Is physical security monitoring implemented?
guidance: Monitoring capability review. Look for: CCTV coverage; access monitoring; security personnel; alarm systems; monitoring hours defined.
what_good_looks_like: CCTV coverage of key areas and access monitoring active and security personnel or monitoring service and alarm systems operational and 24x7 or defined hours
red_flags: No CCTV; Access not monitored; No security personnel; No alarms; Monitoring gaps
nc_pattern: Physical security monitoring not implemented or coverage insufficient.

question: Are monitoring systems continuously operational?
guidance: Monitoring continuity review. Look for: 24x7 coverage where required; recording retention; system redundancy; maintenance schedule; failure alerting.
what_good_looks_like: 24x7 coverage where required and recording retained appropriately and system redundancy and maintenance schedule followed and failure alerting configured
red_flags: Gaps in coverage; Recording not retained; No redundancy; Maintenance overdue; Failures not detected
nc_pattern: Physical monitoring systems not continuously operational or failures not detected.

question: How is monitoring data retained and protected?
guidance: Monitoring data protection review. Look for: retention period defined minimum 30 days; access controls on footage; integrity protection; secure storage.
what_good_looks_like: Retention period defined and access controls on footage and integrity protection and secure storage and audit trail of access and policy documented
red_flags: Retention undefined; Unrestricted access; No integrity protection; Insecure storage; No audit trail
nc_pattern: Physical monitoring data not retained or protected appropriately.

question: Is there response capability for detected events?
guidance: Response capability review. Look for: response procedures documented; security personnel availability; escalation process defined; response times targeted.
auditor_focus: What happens when something is detected?
what_good_looks_like: Response procedures documented and security personnel or service available and escalation process defined and response times targeted and tested periodically
red_flags: No response procedures; Personnel unavailable; Escalation undefined; No response targets; Not tested
nc_pattern: Physical security response capability not defined or not tested.

question: For cloud-based systems how is physical security addressed?
guidance: Cloud physical security review. Look for: cloud provider certifications including SOC 2 and ISO 27001; shared responsibility documentation; certificate review process.
auditor_focus: Show me cloud provider physical security evidence.
what_good_looks_like: Cloud provider certifications verified and shared responsibility documented and certificate review annual and physical security requirements in contracts and evidence on file
red_flags: No provider certifications; Shared responsibility unclear; No certificate review; Not in contracts; No evidence
nc_pattern: Cloud provider physical security not verified or shared responsibility undocumented.

control_name: Protecting Against External and Environmental Threats
question: Are environmental controls in place?
guidance: Environmental protection review. Look for: fire detection and suppression; climate control HVAC; water damage prevention; monitoring of environmental conditions.
what_good_looks_like: Fire detection and suppression and climate control and water damage prevention and environmental monitoring and maintenance schedule and testing records
red_flags: No fire protection; No climate control; Water damage risk; No monitoring; Maintenance not current
nc_pattern: Environmental controls not implemented or not maintained for information processing facilities.

control_name: Protecting Against External and Environmental Threats
question: How are environmental threats assessed?
guidance: Threat assessment review. Look for: environmental risk assessment; natural disaster consideration; external threat evaluation; mitigation measures documented.
auditor_focus: What environmental risks have been assessed?
what_good_looks_like: Environmental risk assessment conducted and natural disasters considered and external threats evaluated and mitigation measures documented and regular review
red_flags: No risk assessment; Natural disasters ignored; External threats not evaluated; No mitigation; Not reviewed
nc_pattern: Environmental threats not assessed or mitigation measures not documented.

question: Are secure area working rules defined?
guidance: Secure area rules review. Look for: rules documented; supervision requirements; prohibited activities; recording device restrictions; access logging.
auditor_focus: What rules apply in secure areas?
what_good_looks_like: Secure area rules documented and supervision where required and prohibited activities defined and recording devices restricted and access logged
red_flags: No rules documented; No supervision; Prohibited activities unclear; Recording allowed; Access not logged
nc_pattern: Working rules for secure areas not defined or not enforced.

question: How is work supervised in secure areas?
guidance: Supervision review. Look for: supervision requirements documented; lone working policies; dual control for sensitive areas; monitoring arrangements.
auditor_focus: Is supervision appropriate for risk level?
what_good_looks_like: Supervision requirements documented and lone working addressed and dual control where needed and monitoring and compliance verified
red_flags: No supervision requirements; Lone working uncontrolled; No dual control; No monitoring
nc_pattern: Supervision in secure areas not appropriate for sensitivity level.

question: How are recording devices controlled in secure areas?
guidance: Recording device control review. Look for: mobile phone policy; camera restrictions; laptop camera covers; enforcement mechanisms; visitor device handling.
what_good_looks_like: Mobile phone policy and camera restrictions and laptop camera covers where needed and enforcement and visitor devices addressed
red_flags: No device policy; Cameras unrestricted; No enforcement; Visitors bring devices freely
nc_pattern: Recording device restrictions not implemented or enforced in secure areas.

question: Is there a clean desk and clear screen policy?
guidance: Clean desk policy review. Look for: policy documentation; compliance checks performed; awareness training; enforcement mechanisms.
what_good_looks_like: Clean desk policy documented and compliance checks performed and awareness training provided and enforcement mechanisms and regular audits
red_flags: No policy; No compliance checks; No training; No enforcement; No audits
nc_pattern: Clear desk and clear screen policy not documented or compliance not verified.

question: How is clear desk compliance verified?
guidance: Compliance verification review. Look for: periodic checks conducted; findings documented; remediation tracked; awareness reinforcement.
what_good_looks_like: Periodic checks conducted and findings documented and remediation tracked and awareness reinforced and trends reported
red_flags: No checks; Findings not documented; No remediation; No reinforcement
nc_pattern: Clear desk compliance not actively monitored or enforced.

question: Are secure storage facilities provided?
guidance: Storage provision review. Look for: lockable drawers or cabinets; secure disposal bins; adequate provision for staff; key management.
what_good_looks_like: Lockable storage provided and secure disposal bins and adequate for all staff and key management and regularly maintained
red_flags: No lockable storage; No disposal bins; Inadequate provision; Key management poor
nc_pattern: Secure storage facilities not provided to enable clear desk compliance.

question: Is equipment sited to reduce environmental risks?
guidance: Equipment siting review. Look for: server room location appropriate; cable routing protected; environmental controls in equipment areas; physical access restricted.
what_good_looks_like: Server room appropriately located and cable routing protected and environmental controls adequate and physical access restricted and documented
red_flags: Poor location; Cables unprotected; Environmental controls inadequate; Access unrestricted; Undocumented
nc_pattern: Equipment not sited to minimise environmental risks or unauthorised access.

question: Is equipment protected from environmental risks?
guidance: Environmental protection review. Look for: raised floors; waterproof covers where needed; climate control; dust protection; vibration isolation.
what_good_looks_like: Raised floors where appropriate and waterproof protection and climate controlled and dust protected and vibration isolated where needed
red_flags: No raised floors; Water risk; No climate control; Dust exposure; Vibration risk
nc_pattern: Equipment not adequately protected from environmental hazards.

question: Is equipment positioned to prevent unauthorised viewing?
guidance: Screen positioning review. Look for: screens positioned away from windows; privacy screens where needed; positioning guidance; compliance checks.
auditor_focus: Can screens be viewed by unauthorised persons?
what_good_looks_like: Screens positioned appropriately and privacy screens and positioning guidance and compliance verified and remediation where needed
red_flags: Screens visible externally; No privacy screens; No guidance; Compliance not checked
nc_pattern: Equipment not positioned to prevent unauthorised viewing of sensitive information.

question: How are assets protected when off-premises?
guidance: Off-premises security review. Look for: authorisation for removal; encryption of portable devices; physical security guidance; tracking of removed assets.
auditor_focus: Are off-site assets tracked and protected?
what_good_looks_like: Authorisation required for removal and encryption of portable devices and physical security guidance provided and assets tracked and regular reconciliation
red_flags: No authorisation; Unencrypted devices; No guidance; Assets not tracked; No reconciliation
nc_pattern: Off-premises asset security not addressed or removed assets not tracked.

question: How are assets tracked when removed from premises?
guidance: Asset tracking review. Look for: removal authorisation process; asset register updates; return tracking; reconciliation procedures.
auditor_focus: Can you account for all off-site assets?
what_good_looks_like: Removal authorisation and register updated and return tracked and reconciliation and complete accountability
red_flags: No authorisation; Register not updated; Return not tracked; No reconciliation
nc_pattern: Off-premises assets not tracked or reconciled with inventory.

question: What physical security guidance is provided for off-site assets?
guidance: Off-site guidance review. Look for: security guidance documented; storage requirements; transport security; loss reporting procedures.
auditor_focus: Do staff know how to protect assets off-site?
what_good_looks_like: Security guidance documented and storage requirements and transport security and loss reporting and acknowledgment obtained
red_flags: No guidance; Requirements unclear; Transport insecure; Reporting unclear
nc_pattern: Physical security guidance not provided for off-premises asset protection.

question: How is storage media managed?
guidance: Storage media management review. Look for: media register maintained; handling procedures; secure storage; encryption where appropriate; tracking of media.
auditor_focus: Is storage media tracked and secured?
what_good_looks_like: Media register maintained and handling procedures documented and secure storage and encryption applied and tracking in place and regular audit
red_flags: No register; No procedures; Insecure storage; No encryption; Not tracked; No audit
nc_pattern: Storage media not managed securely or not tracked in register.

question: How is media disposed of securely?
guidance: Media disposal review. Look for: secure disposal methods defined; certificates of destruction; third party disposal verification; disposal records maintained.
what_good_looks_like: Secure disposal methods including shredding or degaussing and certificates of destruction and third party verification and disposal records maintained and audit trail
red_flags: No secure disposal; No certificates; Third party unverified; Records incomplete; No audit trail
nc_pattern: Storage media disposal not secure or destruction not verified and documented.

question: Are supporting utilities protected?
guidance: Utilities protection review. Look for: UPS systems deployed; generator backup available; redundant cooling; utility monitoring; maintenance records.
what_good_looks_like: UPS systems deployed and generator backup where required and redundant cooling and utility monitoring and maintenance current and testing records
red_flags: No UPS; No generator; No cooling redundancy; No monitoring; Maintenance not current
nc_pattern: Supporting utilities not protected or backup power not adequate for requirements.

question: How are utilities monitored for failures?
guidance: Utility monitoring review. Look for: monitoring systems deployed; alerting configured; escalation procedures; response capability.
auditor_focus: How quickly are utility failures detected?
what_good_looks_like: Monitoring systems and alerting configured and escalation procedures and response capability and tested regularly
red_flags: No monitoring; No alerting; Escalation unclear; Response untested
nc_pattern: Utility monitoring not implemented or failures not detected promptly.

question: Are utilities tested regularly?
guidance: Utility testing review. Look for: UPS testing schedule; generator testing; load testing conducted; test records maintained.
what_good_looks_like: UPS testing scheduled and generator tested and load testing and records maintained and issues addressed
red_flags: No testing schedule; Generator not tested; No load testing; Records incomplete
nc_pattern: Supporting utilities not tested regularly to verify operational capability.

question: How is cabling security maintained?
guidance: Cabling security review. Look for: cable labelling; power and data segregation; physical protection of cables; access restrictions to cabling areas.
what_good_looks_like: Cable labelling in place and power and data segregated and physical protection adequate and access to cabling restricted and documented
red_flags: No labelling; No segregation; Cables unprotected; Access unrestricted; Undocumented
nc_pattern: Cabling security not adequate to prevent tampering or interception.

question: Are network cables protected from interception?
guidance: Cable interception protection review. Look for: cable runs in protected areas; conduit or trunking used; no exposed cabling in public areas; regular inspection.
what_good_looks_like: Protected cable runs and conduit used and no public exposure and regular inspection and documented routes
red_flags: Cables exposed; No conduit; Public area runs; No inspection
nc_pattern: Network cabling not protected from potential interception or tampering.

question: Is cabling documented and labelled?
guidance: Cable documentation review. Look for: cable labelling scheme; documentation maintained; patch panel records; change tracking.
auditor_focus: Can cables be traced and identified?
what_good_looks_like: Labelling scheme and documentation maintained and patch records and change tracking and regular updates
red_flags: No labelling; Documentation missing; Patch records incomplete; Changes not tracked
nc_pattern: Cabling not adequately documented or labelled for maintenance and security.

question: Is equipment maintained according to specifications?
guidance: Equipment maintenance review. Look for: maintenance schedules documented; authorised service personnel; maintenance records current; warranty tracking.
what_good_looks_like: Maintenance schedules documented and authorised personnel only and records current and warranty tracked and manufacturer specifications followed
red_flags: No schedules; Unauthorised personnel; Records not current; Warranty not tracked; Specifications not followed
nc_pattern: Equipment not maintained according to manufacturer specifications or schedules.

question: How is maintenance access controlled?
guidance: Maintenance access review. Look for: maintenance personnel verification; escorting requirements; access logging; supervision for sensitive equipment.
what_good_looks_like: Personnel verification and escorting where required and access logged and supervision for sensitive equipment and documented
red_flags: No verification; No escorting; Access not logged; No supervision
nc_pattern: Maintenance personnel access not controlled or supervised appropriately.

question: Is maintenance performed by authorised personnel only?
guidance: Authorised personnel review. Look for: approved maintainers list; qualification verification; contract requirements; security clearance where required.
what_good_looks_like: Approved maintainers list and qualifications verified and contract requirements and clearance where needed and regular review
red_flags: No approved list; Qualifications not checked; No contract requirements; Clearance not verified
nc_pattern: Maintenance not restricted to authorised and appropriately vetted personnel.

control_name: Secure Disposal or Re-Use of Equipment
question: How are equipment moves and disposals managed?
guidance: Equipment disposal review. Look for: authorisation process for disposal; data sanitisation procedures; secure disposal methods; certificates of destruction.
auditor_focus: How is data wiped before disposal?
what_good_looks_like: Authorisation required for disposal and data sanitisation using approved standards and secure disposal methods and certificates obtained and records maintained
red_flags: No authorisation; No sanitisation; Insecure disposal; No certificates; Records incomplete
nc_pattern: Equipment disposal not managed securely or data sanitisation not verified.

control_name: Secure Disposal or Re-Use of Equipment
question: Is unattended equipment protected?
guidance: Unattended equipment review. Look for: screen lock policies with appropriate timeout; physical locks where needed; automatic logoff; monitoring for violations.
what_good_looks_like: Screen lock policy with timeout maximum 5 minutes and physical locks where appropriate and automatic logoff configured and compliance monitored
red_flags: No screen lock; Timeout too long; No physical locks; No auto-logoff; Compliance not monitored
nc_pattern: Unattended equipment not protected by screen lock or automatic logoff.

question: Provide your endpoint security policy.
guidance: Endpoint policy review. Look for: policy covering corporate devices and BYOD and mobile devices; MDM requirements; security baselines; acceptable use.
what_good_looks_like: Comprehensive endpoint policy covering all device types and MDM requirements specified and security baselines defined and acceptable use included and current
red_flags: No endpoint policy; Device types missing; No MDM requirements; Baselines undefined; Outdated policy
nc_pattern: Endpoint security policy not documented or does not cover all device types.

question: Are endpoints encrypted?
guidance: Encryption deployment review. Look for: full disk encryption; technology used such as BitLocker or FileVault; key management; compliance rate target 100%.
what_good_looks_like: Full disk encryption deployed and technology documented and key management in place and compliance rate at or near 100% and monitoring active
red_flags: No encryption; Partial deployment; No key management; Low compliance rate; No monitoring
nc_pattern: Endpoint devices not encrypted or encryption compliance rate below target.

question: What endpoint protection is deployed?
guidance: EDR deployment review. Look for: AV or EDR solution deployed; central management; signature updates automated; behavioural detection enabled.
what_good_looks_like: EDR or AV solution deployed and centrally managed and signatures updated automatically and behavioural detection enabled and coverage complete
red_flags: No endpoint protection; Not centrally managed; Manual updates; No behavioural detection; Coverage gaps
nc_pattern: Endpoint protection not deployed or not centrally managed with current signatures.

question: How are lost or stolen devices handled?
guidance: Lost device procedures review. Look for: remote wipe capability; reporting process; incident response procedures; device tracking where appropriate.
auditor_focus: Can you remotely wipe a device right now?
what_good_looks_like: Remote wipe capability and documented reporting process and incident response for lost devices and tracking capability where appropriate and tested regularly
red_flags: No remote wipe; No reporting process; No incident response; No tracking; Not tested
nc_pattern: Lost or stolen device procedures not defined or remote wipe capability not available.

question: Are screen locks enforced?
guidance: Screen lock enforcement review. Look for: timeout settings maximum 5 minutes recommended; GPO or MDM enforcement; compliance monitoring; exception handling.
what_good_looks_like: Screen lock timeout configured maximum 5 minutes and enforced via GPO or MDM and compliance monitored and exceptions documented and controlled
red_flags: No screen lock; Timeout too long; Not enforced; Compliance not monitored; Uncontrolled exceptions
nc_pattern: Screen lock timeout not enforced or set above acceptable threshold.

question: How is USB and removable media controlled?
guidance: USB control review. Look for: USB blocking or allow-listing; DLP controls; encryption requirements for approved media; policy enforcement.
what_good_looks_like: USB blocking or allow-listing implemented and DLP controls in place and encryption required for approved media and policy enforced and compliance monitored
red_flags: No USB control; Open USB access; No DLP; No encryption requirement; Not enforced
nc_pattern: USB and removable media access not controlled or policy not enforced.

question: Provide your privileged access inventory.
guidance: Privileged account inventory review. Look for: complete list of privileged accounts; role definitions; justification for each; owner assignments documented.
auditor_focus: Do you know all privileged accounts?
what_good_looks_like: Complete privileged account inventory and role definitions documented and justification for each account and owners assigned and regular reconciliation
red_flags: Incomplete inventory; Roles undefined; No justification; No owners; Not reconciled
nc_pattern: Privileged access inventory incomplete or not maintained.

question: How is privileged access provisioned?
guidance: Provisioning process review. Look for: approval workflow documented; business justification required; least privilege verification; time limits applied where appropriate.
what_good_looks_like: Approval workflow documented and business justification required and least privilege verified and time limits where appropriate and just-in-time where feasible
red_flags: No approval workflow; No justification required; Excessive privileges; Permanent access; No JIT
nc_pattern: Privileged access provisioning lacks approval workflow or least privilege verification.

question: How often is privileged access reviewed?
guidance: Access review process verification. Look for: review frequency minimum quarterly; recertification process; review evidence maintained; actions taken on findings.
auditor_focus: Show me recent privileged access review.
what_good_looks_like: Quarterly or more frequent reviews and recertification process documented and review evidence maintained and actions taken on findings and trend tracking
red_flags: Reviews less than quarterly; No recertification; No evidence; Actions not taken; No trends
nc_pattern: Privileged access not reviewed at required frequency or review evidence not maintained.

question: Is MFA mandatory for privileged accounts?
guidance: MFA enforcement review. Look for: MFA requirement for all privileged access; authentication methods approved; enforcement mechanism; exception handling documented.
what_good_looks_like: MFA mandatory for all privileged access and authentication methods approved and enforcement mechanism and exceptions documented and controlled
red_flags: No MFA requirement; Partial enforcement; Unapproved methods; No enforcement mechanism; Uncontrolled exceptions
nc_pattern: MFA not mandatory for privileged accounts or enforcement not complete.

question: How is privileged activity monitored?
guidance: Activity monitoring review. Look for: session recording where appropriate; command logging; alert triggers defined; log retention; review process.
what_good_looks_like: Session recording for sensitive access and command logging enabled and alert triggers configured and retention adequate and regular review process
red_flags: No session recording; No command logging; No alerts; Inadequate retention; No review
nc_pattern: Privileged activity not monitored or logged with adequate detail and retention.

question: Is a PAM solution deployed?
guidance: PAM deployment review. Look for: PAM tool in use; features enabled including vaulting and rotation and session recording; coverage of privileged accounts.
what_good_looks_like: PAM solution deployed and vaulting enabled and credential rotation and session recording and coverage complete and integration with workflows
red_flags: No PAM solution; Limited features; No rotation; No session recording; Incomplete coverage
nc_pattern: PAM solution not deployed or key features not enabled.

question: How is access restricted based on classification?
guidance: Classification-based access review. Look for: access controls aligned with classification levels; technical enforcement; verification procedures.
auditor_focus: Is access technically enforced by classification?
what_good_looks_like: Access controls aligned with classification and technical enforcement mechanisms and verification procedures and consistent application and audit capability
red_flags: No classification alignment; Not technically enforced; No verification; Inconsistent; Not auditable
nc_pattern: Access restrictions not aligned with information classification levels.

question: How is need-to-know enforced?
guidance: Need-to-know verification review. Look for: access request process; owner approval required; periodic review; access removal when no longer needed.
auditor_focus: How do you verify ongoing need?
what_good_looks_like: Access request process documented and owner approval required and periodic review conducted and access removed when not needed and audit trail
red_flags: No request process; No owner approval; No periodic review; Access not removed; No audit trail
nc_pattern: Need-to-know principle not enforced through access request and review process.

question: Are there controls on data extraction?
guidance: Data extraction controls review. Look for: DLP controls deployed; print restrictions where appropriate; download monitoring; copy and paste limitations where needed.
what_good_looks_like: DLP controls deployed and print restrictions where appropriate and download monitoring and copy controls where needed and alerts configured
red_flags: No DLP; No print restrictions; No download monitoring; No copy controls; No alerts
nc_pattern: Controls on data extraction not implemented or not effective.

question: How is database access controlled?
guidance: Database access control review. Look for: database access controls; query logging; direct access restrictions; service account management.
what_good_looks_like: Database access controls in place and query logging enabled and direct access restricted and service accounts managed and regular review
red_flags: No database controls; No query logging; Unrestricted direct access; Service accounts unmanaged; No review
nc_pattern: Database access not controlled or direct access not appropriately restricted.

question: Are access restrictions auditable?
guidance: Audit capability review. Look for: access logs maintained; permission records; change audit trail; reporting capability.
auditor_focus: Can you audit who accessed what data?
what_good_looks_like: Access logs maintained and permission records complete and change audit trail and reporting capability and retention adequate
red_flags: No access logs; Incomplete records; No audit trail; No reporting; Inadequate retention
nc_pattern: Access restrictions not auditable due to insufficient logging or records.

question: How is source code repository access controlled?
guidance: Repository access review. Look for: repository access management; role-based access; access logging; authentication requirements.
what_good_looks_like: Repository access managed and role-based access implemented and access logging enabled and strong authentication and regular review
red_flags: No access management; No RBAC; No logging; Weak authentication; No review
nc_pattern: Source code repository access not controlled or not logged.

question: Is production code access separately controlled?
guidance: Production code access review. Look for: separation from development access; restricted access; approval process; audit trail.
auditor_focus: Can developers access production code directly?
what_good_looks_like: Production code access separate from development and access restricted and approval required and audit trail maintained and regular review
red_flags: No separation; Unrestricted access; No approval; No audit trail; No review
nc_pattern: Production code access not separately controlled from development access.

question: Are code changes tracked and attributed?
guidance: Code change tracking review. Look for: version control; commit attribution; code review records; branch protection rules.
auditor_focus: Can changes be traced to individuals?
what_good_looks_like: Version control in place and commit attribution required and code review records and branch protection enabled and traceability complete
red_flags: No version control; Anonymous commits; No code review; No branch protection; No traceability
nc_pattern: Code changes not tracked or not attributable to individual developers.

question: How is access to build and deployment tools controlled?
guidance: CI/CD access review. Look for: access restrictions on CI/CD; deployment approvals; secrets management; segregation of duties.
what_good_looks_like: CI/CD access restricted and deployment approvals required and secrets management in place and segregation enforced and audit trail
red_flags: Unrestricted CI/CD access; No deployment approval; Secrets exposed; No segregation; No audit
nc_pattern: Build and deployment tool access not controlled or segregation not enforced.

question: How are software dependencies managed?
guidance: Dependency management review. Look for: approved library sources; vulnerability scanning; SBOM generation; license compliance tracking.
auditor_focus: Do you scan dependencies for vulnerabilities?
what_good_looks_like: Approved library sources defined and vulnerability scanning automated and SBOM generated and license compliance tracked and remediation process
red_flags: No approved sources; No vulnerability scanning; No SBOM; No license tracking; No remediation
nc_pattern: Software dependencies not managed or not scanned for vulnerabilities.

question: What authentication technologies are implemented?
guidance: Authentication technology review. Look for: authentication methods used; password complexity requirements; MFA types deployed; biometrics if applicable.
what_good_looks_like: Authentication methods documented and password complexity enforced and MFA deployed and appropriate methods for risk and regularly reviewed
red_flags: Methods undocumented; Weak passwords allowed; No MFA; Inappropriate methods; Not reviewed
nc_pattern: Authentication technologies not documented or not appropriate for risk level.

question: Where is MFA implemented?
guidance: MFA coverage review. Look for: coverage of remote access and privileged accounts and cloud services and email and internal applications; enforcement.
what_good_looks_like: MFA coverage comprehensive including remote and privileged and cloud and email and critical apps and enforcement verified and compliance monitored
red_flags: Limited MFA coverage; Remote access excluded; Privileged accounts excluded; Cloud gaps; Not enforced
nc_pattern: MFA not implemented comprehensively across required access points.

question: Are default and weak passwords prohibited?
guidance: Password strength enforcement review. Look for: password policy enforcement; default credential detection; password blacklists; complexity requirements.
what_good_looks_like: Password policy enforced technically and default detection capability and password blacklists implemented and complexity requirements and regular testing
red_flags: Weak passwords allowed; Defaults not detected; No blacklists; No complexity; Not tested
nc_pattern: Default or weak passwords not prohibited or detection not in place.

question: How are authentication failures handled?
guidance: Authentication failure handling review. Look for: account lockout policy; failed attempt logging; alerting on suspicious activity; unlock process.
what_good_looks_like: Account lockout policy configured and failed attempts logged and alerts for suspicious patterns and documented unlock process and monitoring
red_flags: No lockout; Failures not logged; No alerting; No unlock process; No monitoring
nc_pattern: Authentication failures not handled securely or not logged for analysis.

question: Is there protection against credential attacks?
guidance: Credential attack protection review. Look for: rate limiting; CAPTCHA where appropriate; account lockout; brute force detection; credential stuffing protection.
what_good_looks_like: Rate limiting implemented and CAPTCHA where appropriate and account lockout and brute force detection and credential stuffing protection and monitoring
red_flags: No rate limiting; No CAPTCHA; No lockout; No detection; No stuffing protection
nc_pattern: Protection against credential attacks not implemented or not comprehensive.

question: How is system capacity monitored?
guidance: Capacity monitoring review. Look for: monitoring tools deployed; metrics tracked; dashboards available; alerting thresholds configured.
what_good_looks_like: Monitoring tools deployed and key metrics tracked and dashboards available and alerting thresholds configured and regular review
red_flags: No monitoring tools; Metrics not tracked; No dashboards; No alerting; No review
nc_pattern: System capacity not monitored or key metrics not tracked.

question: Is there capacity planning?
guidance: Capacity planning review. Look for: forecasting methodology; growth projections; resource planning; budget alignment.
what_good_looks_like: Forecasting methodology documented and growth projections made and resource planning aligned and budget provision and regular updates
red_flags: No forecasting; No projections; No resource planning; No budget alignment; Not updated
nc_pattern: Capacity planning not conducted or not aligned with business growth.

question: What alerts exist for capacity thresholds?
guidance: Alerting configuration review. Look for: alert configuration; threshold levels appropriate; escalation procedures; response actions defined.
what_good_looks_like: Alerts configured for key metrics and threshold levels appropriate and escalation procedures and response actions defined and tested
red_flags: No alerts; Inappropriate thresholds; No escalation; Response undefined; Not tested
nc_pattern: Capacity threshold alerts not configured or thresholds not appropriate.

question: How is capacity scaled when needed?
guidance: Scaling capability review. Look for: scaling procedures; auto-scaling capability; manual intervention process; emergency scaling procedures.
auditor_focus: Can you scale quickly if needed?
what_good_looks_like: Scaling procedures documented and auto-scaling where appropriate and manual process defined and emergency procedures and tested
red_flags: No scaling procedures; No auto-scaling; Manual process unclear; No emergency procedure; Not tested
nc_pattern: Capacity scaling procedures not defined or not tested.

question: Is redundancy implemented for critical systems?
guidance: Redundancy review. Look for: high availability architecture; failover capability; redundant components; SLA alignment.
what_good_looks_like: HA architecture for critical systems and failover capability and redundant components and SLA aligned and tested regularly
red_flags: No HA; No failover; No redundancy; SLA misaligned; Not tested
nc_pattern: Redundancy not implemented for critical systems or availability requirements not met.

question: Is anti-malware deployed across all endpoints?
guidance: Anti-malware coverage review. Look for: coverage rate target 100%; solution deployed; central management; compliance monitoring.
what_good_looks_like: Anti-malware deployed with 100% coverage target and solution documented and centrally managed and compliance monitored and gaps addressed
red_flags: Coverage below target; Solution outdated; Not centrally managed; No compliance monitoring; Gaps ignored
nc_pattern: Anti-malware not deployed to all endpoints or coverage below target.

question: Are signatures and definitions updated automatically?
guidance: Update process review. Look for: automatic update frequency; compliance monitoring; offline device handling; update verification.
what_good_looks_like: Automatic updates configured and update frequency adequate and compliance monitored and offline devices addressed and verification in place
red_flags: Manual updates; Infrequent updates; Compliance not monitored; Offline devices ignored; No verification
nc_pattern: Malware signatures and definitions not updated automatically or not current.

question: Is malware scanning performed on email and web traffic?
guidance: Gateway protection review. Look for: email gateway scanning; web proxy scanning; sandboxing capability; detonation for suspicious content.
what_good_looks_like: Email gateway scanning and web proxy scanning and sandboxing capability and detonation for suspicious and coverage complete
red_flags: No email scanning; No web scanning; No sandboxing; No detonation; Coverage gaps
nc_pattern: Email and web traffic not scanned for malware at gateway level.

question: How are malware detections handled?
guidance: Detection response review. Look for: alert triage process; investigation procedures; containment actions; remediation; reporting.
auditor_focus: Walk me through a recent detection.
what_good_looks_like: Alert triage process documented and investigation procedures and containment actions defined and remediation tracked and reporting to management
red_flags: No triage process; No investigation procedures; No containment; Remediation not tracked; No reporting
nc_pattern: Malware detection response process not defined or not followed.

question: Is user awareness training provided for malware?
guidance: Malware awareness review. Look for: training content on malware; phishing simulations; suspicious file handling; reporting procedures.
auditor_focus: What malware topics are covered in training?
what_good_looks_like: Training content includes malware awareness and phishing simulations conducted and suspicious file handling covered and reporting procedures included and refreshed regularly
red_flags: No malware training; No phishing simulations; File handling not covered; Reporting unclear; Not refreshed
nc_pattern: User awareness training does not adequately cover malware threats and response.

question: Describe your patch management process.
guidance: Patch management review. Look for: patch identification process; testing requirements; deployment procedures; emergency procedures; rollback capability.
auditor_focus: How are patches identified and deployed?
what_good_looks_like: Patch identification process documented and testing before deployment and deployment procedures and emergency patching and rollback capability
red_flags: No identification process; No testing; Procedures undefined; No emergency process; No rollback
nc_pattern: Patch management process not documented or key steps missing.

question: What are your patching SLAs?
guidance: Patching SLA review. Look for: critical patches 7 to 14 days; high patches 30 days; medium patches 60 days; compliance metrics; exception handling.
what_good_looks_like: Patching SLAs documented with critical 7 to 14 days and high 30 days and medium 60 days and compliance metrics tracked and exceptions documented
red_flags: No SLAs; Timeframes too long; Compliance not tracked; Metrics not reported; Exceptions uncontrolled
nc_pattern: Patching SLAs not defined or compliance not tracked against timeframes.

question: How often is penetration testing conducted?
guidance: Penetration testing schedule review. Look for: annual minimum frequency; scope defined; qualified testers; methodology documented.
auditor_focus: When was the last pen test?
what_good_looks_like: Annual or more frequent testing and scope covers critical systems and qualified testers engaged and methodology documented and management approved
red_flags: Less than annual; Scope limited; Unqualified testers; No methodology; Not approved
nc_pattern: Penetration testing not conducted annually or scope insufficient.

question: How are penetration test findings remediated?
guidance: Finding remediation review. Look for: finding tracking; remediation timelines; verification testing; retest results.
what_good_looks_like: Findings tracked in register and remediation timelines defined and verification testing conducted and retest confirms closure and management reporting
red_flags: Findings not tracked; No timelines; No verification; No retest; No reporting
nc_pattern: Penetration test findings not tracked or remediation not verified.

question: Is vulnerability scanning conducted regularly?
